displaytitle: Crucifixion with the Virgin and Saint John the Evangelist
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor wash with white heightening on dark blue prepared light tan paper, squared in brown ink
creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.
inscribed:
Inscribed verso, upper center, in graphite: Scuola del
Perugino- (dal dipinto del maestro all’Ermitage (ora a
Washington) di Leningrado No1666, già esequito nel `497, ma da
riportare al 1485 circa) (Tiberio di Assisi?) / 6000; center, in
black ink: 84 ; left center, in graphite: cm 42 x 26

titles.title: Crucifixion with the Virgin and Saint John the Evangelist

makers.displaydate: 1450–1523; born Città della Pieve, Italy; died Fontignano, Italy
makers.displaymaker: after Perugino (Pietro di Cristoforo Vannucci), 1450–1523; born Città della Pieve, Italy; died Fontignano, Italy

bibliography.boilertext: Laura Giles, Lia Markey, Claire Van Cleave, et. al., Italian Master Drawings from the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2014).

caption: After Perugino (Pietro di Cristoforo Vannucci) (1450–1523; born Città della Pieve, Italy; died Fontignano, Italy), Crucifixion with the Virgin and Saint John the Evangelist. Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor wash with white heightening on dark blue prepared light tan paper, squared in brown ink; 42.1 × 26.4 cm. Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr. (x1976-70)
